description: It has a bit of a learning curve but worth it. There are many tutorials to get you started.
Discover store link broken. Installs incorrectly, had to go to terminal and manually ask to install it with apt
Great part design software and more for free
summary: Great part design software and more for free

description:
I love this app. Freecad, for me, is the best alternative of Autodesk Inventor, its free!!
I hope it'll always exist and keep growing. I don't care about people's bad reviews about missing icon and they have to use terminal to open it, even 9YO kids can do that without whining. I wont complain because I know how hard to develop a software is... It is unimaginably hard. As long as Freecad is free, I feel grateful when using it.
great to do drawings for 3d printing

in Ubuntu 19.04 after installation of the freeCAD there will be no launcher icon in the application menu. Therefore we have to go to the terminal and type "freecad to launch the application and by any chance we close the terminal window the freeCAD application will be closed with works executed down the drain.
Whatever you wanted to draw.. you can do with Freecad.. more or less long time, but super powerfull software !!

I have used this for a few years now. I am very happy with it. It's not really on par with SolidWorks and Pro/E (yet)., but with patience and a bit on understanding it's very very powerful. 

In the time I've used it, FreeCAD has gotten a lot better. I really hope this program continues development. It's really great and for FOSS, amazing.
Just a newbie to Freecad... I have high hope for its development.
summary: At last, a "normal" 3D CAD in Linux

description: Absolutely the best free (and open source) 3D modelling software!

I have found this to be a VERY good little CAD program for very basic 3D printing. I used it to design a walkie-talkie clip and an oversized zipper pull for use with heavy gloves. I wouldn't use it for tabletop gaming minis or whatever, but for practical prints, pattern making for casting, etc, absolutely.

But beware - better download FreeCAD from the official website. In this repository it's said that it's 0.17 version, but it's not - it's still 0.16 (even though in the application info it will show you 0.17). I lost many hours trying to deal with problems that are already solved in the newer version.
summary: Great and fast developing, powerful software!

description: Honestly not the best GUI and blender is a far more popular program for 3D editing.
This software is as free as it gets, and has tremendous functionality, it is being heavily developed by a great team of capable people.

I am a biomedical engineer and I really love using this to make my models. I have access to all the expensive industry standards (Solidworks, AutoCAD, etc.), but I love supporting libre software, and this program actually does everything I need.
The FreeCad has an excellent performance history under Ubuntu 16.04. Under Ubuntu 18.04 it is missing packages that Ubuntu does not like.
summary: Works Great with Ubuntu 16.04. Dead-On-Arrival with Ubuntu 18.04

description: Suffers from the problem effecting many Linux programs
probably best of free cad software
FreeCAD is a powerful alternative for commercial parametric softwares in market! Developers, thank you!
creepy: Can't uninstall because of unmet dependencies? huh?
It says it's installed, but no launcher and no command-line executable.

The software worked great on ubuntu 18.04, untill I updated to Ubuntu 20.04 LTS version, and when I try to start FEM i got the following workbench failure message:
"libnglib.so:cannot open shared object file : No such file or directory"
summary: Great app but problem with ubuntu 20.04

description: All in one CAD software and the thing is it is completely free...

There is no launcher icon in the application menu after installing .
To Solve that issue in terminal:
sudo apt install freecad-python2 # version 0.18.3+dfsg1-1, or
sudo apt install freecad-python3 # version 0.18.3+dfsg1-1
when hit the launch button it does not launch

This app has a very poor interface to work with, cluttered, disorganized, mouse/touch pad functionality poor, viewing is horrible. If you know how to write code, I'd recommend writing your own CAD app before using this one. It'll probably be better than this app.
summary: Poorly Designed App, would NOT recommend

description:
error when using FEM: "libnglib.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory."

Dependencies aren't mentioned clearly.
One of the best program with big potential.
summary: The Best CAD Program in the world

description: Over the last month, having never used a CAD package before, Freecad is now a major fixture in my life. I'm using it heavily to design 3D printed parts, furniture, and planning home renovations. I love it.
Nothing to launch and nothing for the terminal.
It's great for 3d printing. It's also good as a normal 2d CAD. (PRO tip: you can open it easily by using shortcut alt + f2 and then typing freeCAD) :>
summary: It's great, but you have to open it using terminal

description: So happy that this is available.
Launch is not working. Status is installed. Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS.
Excelente Aparentemente muito Simples .mas na Verdade um Grande Software.
The install is missing an icon and an executable to launch. There is no file called FreeCAD that can be launched.
i used 'sudo apt install freecad' instead

Installs ok. Launches ok. But try to create a new document from the tile or menu, it closes the application. Also can not uninstall due to the dependencies it has. 
Running Linux Distro Fenix on Raspberry Pi4 overclocked CPU @2.0Ghz and GPU@750Mhz
No desktop icon and no 'freecad' command to launch from terminal is available.
Have not oppened any of my .dwg files
Freecad can't be found after install

FreeCAD itself is awesome and I don't want to reduce ratings for it by giving a low rating here. But the Ubuntu Software version 0.19.1+dfsg1-2 is broken, as it does not appear to install an executable binary anywhere (though it installs lots of other files required by FreeCAD).
its free CAD. It keeps getting better, 0.19 comes with some improvements.

Discover doesn't install freecad, apt install from terminal works well.
$ sudo apt install freecad

Appears to point to the wrong installation. After installing checked in Muon. Muon says it installed solely the common files bundle, which is just a part of what is needed. The menu has a link to /usr/bin/freecad which does not exist until you load the rest. Hence the missing installer comments. Installing "freecad" using Muon works for me.
no launcher in gnome
So, how do I help get this on Debian?

I have installed FreeCAD 3 times and no menu item shows up.  
so, I am now using the FreeCAD appimage instead with a menu item I created though there is no icon and I can't find any either.

After installing this through Ubuntu Software, it claims to be installed. But I can't find it anywhere. It didn't create an icon under applications, and it's not in my path. Where in the #@!# is the program installed at?
summary: Installs - no start icon and not in path?

description: FreeCAD has a steep learnig curve but is very powerful if you put time in to learn . There are many videos and howto's to help as well as the wiki and a pdf manual.

With FreeCAD, your 3d models are saved in an open file format; anyone can edit them for free. If you're still using Tinkercad to make your 3D creations or trying to sculpt mechanical tools in Blender, this app will be a game-changer.
FreeCAD isn't as fully-featured as professional CAD software, but the ability to share files with anyone and the lack of annoying user registration keys is worth it to me. Also, FreeCAD won't have its 1.0 release for a while. There is a large user base and even larger ambitions from the developers.
summary: If you have a 3d printer, get this app!

description: Best option on linux, but it's far to be comparable to the more mainstreem app

When you follow the "tutorial" and the things that it describes and tells you to do don't happen on your screen, what do you do then? A steep learning curve is ok, but not if it can't even get its own instruction right. I have no problem paying for software that works, and I am more than happy to donate money if it' s good, usable software. This isn't it.
great app, would recommend
i installed it but no icon found.....
I am so sorry to find this app decades back comparing to original cad solutions, unlike to other software on Linux

Yes, currently there is no icon and I have to launch the program through the software library app, but c'mon. It's an amazing and FREE tool supported by a thoughtful and hardworking community. Further more it works smoothly once opened and has tons of great features. Of course it can't compete with solidworks and the like, but as a hobbyist I find that it has everything I need and more for my 3d printing needs.
Doesn't work on Ubuntu 18.04
who creates an app that doesnt have a launcher. I was seconds away from deleting this because i thought this may have been a virus until i saw others had the same problem.
You can launch the program from this page if you have issues on Ubuntu 18.04. Launcher issue requesting canberra-gtk-module.
summary: Need to be able to Export .3ds. Needs use of layers

description: very good free of charge CAD system supports,import and exports a lot of cad files

I have used this app for 3D Printing and prototype design for quite a while. Love it and much appreciated! For those using Ubuntu 19+ and and a terminal window to get around the lack of an app launcher, FreeCad should be listed in the Ubuntu software app under "Installed" apps. Launch it there and you don't need to keep the terminal window open.
summary: Great 3D printing design and prototyping app!

description:
It is a gread apprication for engineering. I do all my analyses with it.
For those interested in FEM, the AppImage already come with the correct links for NetGen, GMsh and Calculix. Make sure you have them installed.
The bleading-edge from ppa does not come with the links either. Use AppImage, compiled with Conda
summary: Better use the AppImage from FreeCad

description: Can do the 3D structure easily.
summary: Great app, also works in windows

description: I'm loving this so far, great that its free for beginners like me, one question though is why doesn't it create a short cut anywhere on my computer I'm always having to go look for it in my software list?

Okay, but I suggest to update its launcher. I have to install "them" (FreeCAD and its support files and packages) through steps:

(1)   you could download FreeCAD installer (version 0.18.3) at its oficial  
      website:
     
     https://www.freecadweb.org/downloads.php

(2)  open wiki which explaines about its instalation on UNIX-based OS 
     (included Ubuntu) : 

     https://www.freecadweb.org/wiki/Install_on_Unix  

(3)  Install FreeCAD in Ubuntu terminal (especially 18.04.3 LTS) by this 
	 syntax below
 
     sudo add-apt-repository ppa:freecad-maintainers/freecad-stable

(4)  you will get notification after execute syntax at step (3)
     
     " Note: the freecad-doc package brings offline FreeCAD help support, 
     and needs to be installed separately.. 
     
     Note: the ccx package brings CalculiX support to the FEM workbench,
     and needs to be installed separately ".
     
     Therefore, you could continue coding at Ubuntu terminal.
     
(5)  Just in case, you could check its last update through
     
     sudo apt-get update

(6)   you could start installing freecad-doc package by the following syntax:

      "  sudo apt-get install freecad freecad-doc && sudo apt-get upgrade  "

      It can also upgrade previous installed software simultaneously.

(7)  You maybe get notes

     "The following packages have unmet dependencies:
     
     freecad : Depends: freecad-python3 but it is not going to be 
               installed or freecad-python2 but it is not going to be 
               installed
     E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages ".

    Therefore, after this step, you could install freecad-python2 and 
	freecad-python3 by

    sudo apt-get install freecad-python2
    sudo apt-get install freecad-python3

(10)  You could try to lauch FreeCAD 0.18 although it's completed yet. In my case, FreeCAD has icon and can be added as favorites.

(11)  You should start installing packages for support to the FEM workbench, but so far I've installed them yet. Therefore, I will continue my comment in the next moment.

*I'm so sorry if the grammar, vocabulary, and contexts aren't really acceptable.

Thank you.

Its free which is awesome. Learning to use it is also free. After here and there playing with it for a year or so I am actually designing real parts. But certain bugs or iteams that make it hard to use are a pain. I will list them in hopes they get fixed. Also to anyone reading this 5 stars is what it deserves.
1. No launcher after the last update of linux..
2. No toolbox / windows box if you close your dialogue box....
3. Making sketches into parts is a hard upward climb.
4. No drag and move and no drag and view change function I know of... Can make using this slow as. 

But that being said. I can make parts after following some net guides easily enough.

This Opensource software has a great development potential. I hope it'll continue growing, and one day it'll be a real BIM software alternative.
I thank all those who are working on it.
This may not be the best CAD application out there, but for the price, it is pretty great! Thanks, devs!
They really should keep up to date the official store on linux...still 0.18 but we are on 0.18.4
summary: Please update the store with the latest!

description: This app is very usefull. There is no launcher .. but its okay
In old version, it was simple to create pod from sketch. No I need a body. No (bad) documentation. Trail and error to find how to do. When creating more than 12 fillets, crush down.
Supposedly, it's a great piece of software; to believe that, I need it not to consistently crash when creating a simplest object. Moving on to other alternatives.

Under Ubuntu 16.04 everything seems to perform satisfactorily for my needs" fishing lures (waterline and pockets), hold down fixturing, brass engraving, wooden boxes (pockets, and pads). 

If you are using inches instead of mm, cm you will need to juggle a bit. The spreadsheets work nicely, once you start using them. The Path Work Bench needs a little tweaking of the tool inputs for diameter. 

Under Ubuntu 18.04 nothing. 

Bottom-line stay away from Ubuntu 18.04. It is not ready for prime-time. 

But FreeCad 18.4 is smooth. Special thanks go to the developer community.
I love this cad.
It does not install properly. There is no icon in my applications
summary: The only way to launch it is through the software centre

description: crashes when opening new file

Works fine and acts ask expected.
Ubuntu 19.04

Ставлю 1 звезду, только для того, что бы разаработчики обратили внимание на ошибки в работе программы.
1. При установке, программа не отображается в меню приложений. Ubuntu 18.04
2. При построении модели, и повороте, модель начинает усекаться невидимой проскостью или исчезает совсем. Вернуть видимость не представляется возможным. 
3. Нет точки вокруг которой можно вращать тедаль, она постоянно бегает по всему экрану.

Господа, это шикарная программа, но устраните пожалуйста эти детские болезни. Особенно если учесть что они появляются в программе для стабильной сборки Убунту.

Программе ставлю 5 *****

Create a file on the desktop (example "Freecad.desktop"). Edit the file with text editor and paste the following code in it and save it.
The file must be ".desktop"
If you can find an icon for it you can specify the path to it...

#!/usr/bin/env xdg-open
[Desktop Entry]
Version=
Type=Application
Terminal=false
Exec=freecad
Name=Freecad
Comment=Freecad
Icon=
summary: How to create a desktop launch for Freecad

description: It does not works with ubuntu 20.04
after the 20.04 Update the Fem Workbench stopped working. Even when directing to correct directory

Good tutorials and documentation. Had to read the intro to get started, but no surprises once I read the docs. Excellent FOSS, with excellent feature set. Interface is consistent so that my experience with non-FOSS CAD made it easy to use.
summary: Does everything I expect a CAD app to do

description: Does not add icon to access
May be a good application but after install that not appear application launcher. Ubuntu 20.04. Please Fix it.

FreeCAD is an awesome app. I had no previous experience with CAD software and after trying out a few of the free or open source CAD solutions I kept coming back to FreeCAD. 
 For me there was a lot to learn, but I have always found a example or tutorial online to point me in the right direction to solve any problem I have encountered.
 And the Path workbench is awesome. I love being able to draw something and then so easily produce the G-code for my hobbist cnc mill.
 Thanks to all the FreeCAD contributors
summary: An incredible app and I love using it

description:
Package is broken (various modules don work) in ubuntu 20.04.
Looks like some functionality relies on 32 bit libraries.
Do something about it .
it was not showing after installing it.we have to type in terminal to open the application.

I do have two PCs, one with the 32-bits Ubuntu 18.04 version and other with the 64 bits version. FreeCad 0.18.4 works like a charm in the 32-bits version when installed through the command prompt. Same procedure on the 16 bits version install the FreeCad 0.16 instead. FreeCad installled through Ubuntu Software does not work in either. 

It is worth it to make it work. The software is great. Good luck installing it.

perfectly stable and easy to learn CAD program that even allows to use python scripts, e.g. for animation purposes. 
Great tool for anyone who wants to get into 3D printing.
you siriously have to open it with the terminal...i mean...why do you even have a store haha? please fix that
Seriously powerful and regularly updated.
Best for machining and design ! Perfect to CNC! Thank for team FreeCAD!

FreeCAD ist einfach nur Klasse!
Man kann alles machen, was man so braucht um 3D Modelle zu erstellen. Und das alles ohne zu zahlen oder ein Konto zu brauchen!
Sehr schön!

Sehr starkes Programm um 3D Teile für den 3D-Drucker zu designen. Die Part Workbench ist für Noobs wie mich ein perfekter Einstieg um hochpräzise Modelle in kürzester Zeit zu realisieren. Die Speicherformate sind absolut brauchbar. Man kann die Dateien in Blender importieren. Aber viel wichtiger ist die Combo FreeCad und Cura (4.2.1). Eine echte Bank!! Weiter so.
Nach dem Start führt jede weitere Aktion zum Absturz. Weshalb wird dieser Schrott überhaupt von Ubuntu in die Programmliste aufgenommen?
wird aber nicht angezeigt...und damit nicht verwendbar!

Nach der Manuellen Installation mittels "sudo apt-get install freecad" - welche länger dauerte funktioniert es.

Man weiß nie ob man es falch macht es nicht get oder es einfach grade abgestrürtzt ist. 
Aber manchmal funktioniert es. dan ist es ok

description:
Auch ich hatte nach der Installation diese Abstürze.
Behoben hatte ich dies durch:
Synaptic Package Manager starten > dort nach FreeCAD suchen > im Status alle auswählen > Anzeige: 
freecad
freecad-common
freecad-python3
Alle 3 auswählen und zum installieren vormerken > dann anwenden
Nach der Installation startet FreeCAD so wie immer.

This software is capable to replace professional solutions on cheap hardware. The learning curve is quite steep, as with all parametric CAD programs. But the reward is there and the freecad community is very helpful and they know waht they are talking about. Especially the forums and the tutorials and handbooks are excellent. HAve fun with this mighty tool.

Top CAD Anwendung mit unfassbar vielen Möglichkeiten - das Limit sitzt in dem Fall eher vor der Tastatur. Top Tool zum erstellen unserer 3D-Druck Teile und einfachen Werkstücken für eine Eigenbau- CNC-Fräse.

Habe mehrere CAD Programme ausprobiert und bin immer noch bei FreeCAD. Es ist der Hammer und wenn man mal den dreh raus hat, sind auch grosse Projekte ohne Problem möglich. und es wird mit jedem updat immer besser.
Im Software zweimal verfügbar, leider lässt sich eine Version tatsächlich installieren, beim Start stürzt diese aber sofort ab.
gibt Opensource nichts Besseres, man muss sich damit jedoch richtig beschäftigen bevor was geht

description: no aparece acceso

en Ubuntu 18.04 fresquito recién instalado, mal, no funciona, se cae cuando se quiere utilizar, la interfaz gráfica está sucia. 

Sin embargo es mejor instalar utilizando la terminal, de manera muy sencilla.

Ctrl+Alt+T
Pegar linea a linea los siguientes comandos

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:freecad-maintainers/freecad-stable

sudo apt update

sudo apt install freecad

Luego ya buscar en el listado de aplicaciones Freecad y ejecutar.
Al actualizar la versión se desinstala... no se queda como en segundo plano y no vuelve ha abrir
summary: desde el maletín del escritorio abre y se cierra

description:
A pesar de tratarse de una versión preliminar, tiene gran número de utilidades, trabajo con impresoras 3D y máquinas CNC y la verdad no sé que haría sin esta aplicación.
Quiero dar las gracias a los desarrolladores por éste gran trabajo y por compartirlo con toda la comunidad, por contribuir a que el conocimiento llegue a todas aquellas personas que lo buscan. Es por todo ello una labor sobresaliente. Gracias una vez más.
solo vayan a su terminal y escriban FREECAD

He probado varios, Wings 3D, Tinkercad, Blender...
Si quieres diseñar piezas en 3D de la forma más sencilla posible (escribiendo coordenadas y sumando o restando figuras), este es tu programa, no busques más.
Lo uso en mi Linux, en Windows, y lo voy a intentar también con la Raspberry. Ojalá hagan un port para Android y iOS, de verdad que es increíble.
Gracias a todo el equipo!
summary: El mejor programa de diseño 3D libre

description: La mejor opción para quienes les interesa el software libre, clara y eficiente y con una comunidad que apoyan para que el aprendizaje sea fluido y sencillo
summary: Excelente opción para principiantes y avanzados

le meilleur modeleur Parametrique CAO sous Linux.
l'interface peux semblée ancienne, mais est facilement modifiable pour quelque chose de plus actuel.
comme un modeleur CAO, ce n'est pas une application des plus facile a prendre en mains pour les personnes non inicié a CAO... mais ça reste possiblen beaucoup de materiel d'apprentissage dispo en ligne et Forum tres actif

Superbe, mais des fois manque de l'intuitivité sur certain outils
Formidable pour céer des pièces et les retoucher après-coup. Génial pour exporter en STL pour les impressions 3D.
summary: Un logiciel indispensable pour les makers

description: J'aime beaucoup cet appli très facile a utiliser et on apprend vite.

Il faut se motiver un peu pour réussir à prendre en main Freecad, mais une fois qu'on a fait cet effort, cette application permet de réaliser beaucoup de chose et répond à la quasi totalité des besoins de CAO (Conception Assistée par Ordinateur) courants
comment le mettre en francais ?
pourquoi cette version existe telle, du dev en plus pour une apli plus lourde et moins bien integré ?

Une version stable est proposé sur:
https://doc.ubuntu-fr.org/freecad
J'utilise depuis un moment sur windows, j'ai voulu essayer sur linux, je peux l'installer mais pas le lancer donc j'espère qu'une mise à jour règlera le souci.
Super simple a utiliser et libre

Il manquait ce genre d'application Open-source pour le commun des mortel. Je suis encore en alfa (0.19) mais le logiciel a l'air prometteur et sera un concurrent de poids pour les habitués du secteur (CAO-DAO-FAO) lorsqu'il sera terminé !
Non seulement elle elle est super mais Gratuite elle en fait autant que celle a 7000 euros et évolue en permanence . bravo et merci au concepteur

Когданибудь из этого проекта может выйти работоспособная система.... но сейчас она в самом начале разработки.

Множество ляпов/недодделок :
- модули сборки только самописные - так что не факт, что собранную с их помощью сборку откроете через год - другой
- Невозможно обращатся к параметрам размеров/элементов как к переменным (например взять значение вытягивания из какоголибо размера в эскизе)
-вытягивание только всего эскиза целиком
- огромная толщина линий в эскизах
и т.д.
summary: Пока лучшая 3D-cad для линукс - но очень сыро

description: На линукс минт запускается без проблем. Тут устанавливается и на этом все.
Версия из депо убунту не закускается на кубунте 20
Не открывает файлы и очень сложно удалить. Не рекомендую
После установки не запускается.
Для свободного ПО очень круто! Ее нужно изучать!
Ставьте через snap или apt но не этот пакет.
К сожалению не запускается программа!

Kubuntu 20.04
Ошибка "Невозможно найти программу «/usr/bin/freecad»"
Может не так удобно как AutoCAD или КОМПАС, пока еще не оценил полностью, но я кажется нашел достойную замену этим платным приложениям для не сложного моделирования.
от версии к версии заметен прогресс в развитии. Если продолжит развиваться в том же темпе, станет конкурентом 3D CAD начального уровня.

Интуитивное расположение кнопок. Функциональность хорошая, но логика работы некоторых инструментов могла быть и лучше. Например при создании эскиза размеры отрезков, кругов, прямоугольников и т.д. не задаются сразу, надо менять размер с помощью отдельного инструмента. Возможно это можно настроить и я просто не знаю как, если найду отредактирую отзыв.
summary: пока что лучшее что я нашел на замену inventor

description: После установки не появился в списке приложений и не запускается с менеджера приложений(
не отображается в меню установленных UBUNTU 18.04 приложений
Приложение открывается из терминала командой freecad
试试看 试试看 试试看 试试看
非常好的一款3D建模软件。就是使用学习的资料太少了，如果有配套的教程就更完美了！

有点小问题
1.捕捉工具栏图标不显示
2.开始菜单找不到软件，要在终端打开
